timeline.description: At 17 years old, after a math teacher told him 'You'll never amount to anything,' George believed him and dropped out of high school about six weeks later to join the Navy.

Served as a youth leader and youth pastor at his local church in Ohio while working at Pizza Hut and studying to become ordained. Discovered his creative side when the church added a projection system for songs and sermon notes, and he built their website.

While serving as youth pastor, expressed frustration about unfulfilled blessings. A prophetess named Juanita told him: 'When are you gonna realize you're the blessing?' This redirected his focus from seeking blessings to becoming one.

Taught himself design and web development using Lynda.com over one weekend to learn InDesign. Found a Craigslist ad for an agency in Akron, Ohio and secured a position. Also worked at a water park while teaching himself Adobe Photoshop.

Working at Wild Boy agency in Massillon, Ohio, won tickets to HubSpot's INBOUND conference through a Twitter contest during 'the world's largest webinar.' This experience fundamentally changed his brain - 'The humanity-focused message of HubSpot spoke to my soul and my purpose.'

timeline.milestone: Wild Boy - Rookie Partner of the Year
timeline.description: Wild Boy agency won HubSpot's Rookie Partner of the Year award, marking a significant achievement in their HubSpot journey.

timeline.milestone: Wild Boy Agency Closes / Joins The Sales Lion
timeline.description: Wild Boy agency closed its doors. Around this time, Marcus Sheridan called and offered George a job at The Sales Lion. This began a transformative period of learning about communication, professional speaking, authenticity, and business operations.

At dinner at the Cheesecake Factory before his first keynote, Marcus Sheridan told him to open with being a high school dropout. After resistance, Marcus said: 'Until you embrace being vulnerable, you're going to miss out on the magic in life.' George opened with his dropout story, leading to a powerful conversation with an attendee about life and forgiveness.
Delivered his first talk at HubSpot's INBOUND conference. Has spoken at INBOUND every year since.
Marcus Sheridan encouraged George to start a podcast. This led to recording 271 episodes of the Hubcast, becoming a cornerstone of his educator brand.

timeline.milestone: Part Owner at The Sales Lion
timeline.description: Rose from employee to part owner at The Sales Lion within four years, demonstrating his owner's mentality and growth.

timeline.milestone: The Sales Lion Merges with IMPACT
timeline.description: The Sales Lion merged with IMPACT, a HubSpot agency based in Connecticut. George joined briefly (~4 months) but struggled with the transition from a small close-knit team to a larger organization.

Joined Remington and Rachel Begg at Impulse Creative as Inbound Evangelist. Recognized the company name reflected his personal identity ('I am impulsive...creative...always thinking, always creating'). Built Sprocket Talk community and created thousands of educational videos.
Founded his own company, initially swearing he would never create an agency. Realized he had become a leader, not just a 'number two guy.'

George B. Thomas, LLC evolved into Sidekick Strategies. Developed the Superhuman Framework as his signature methodology for personal and organizational transformation. Launched Beyond Your Default podcast focused on living beyond the default life.

coreIdentity.tagline: Speaker, trainer, catalyst, and overall happy, helpful, humble, HubSpot helper
coreIdentity.mission: To help Humans and organizations align their purpose, passion, and persistence to create lasting, meaningful growth.
coreIdentity.vision: Empowering individuals to live 'Beyond Your Default' - breaking free from what we're told to accept and reaching for something bigger and greater through education, personal development, and human connection.
values: Serving as a blessing to others
personalDefinitions: The HubSpot educator who transformed his passion into a business
The dedicated father and husband who smiles so damn big every day because of his family
The man of faith who sees purpose beyond himself

superhumanFramework.description: A practical roadmap for elevating both personal and professional life, designed as a 'dashboard for your life' to check in on key areas regularly.

fourCornerstones.purpose: The underlying 'why' behind everything - the thing that drives you when you're exhausted or ready to tap out.
fourCornerstones.passion: The fire - what gets you excited to show up and do the work, even when it's hard or when it feels like you're not getting anywhere.
fourCornerstones.persistence: The grit that keeps us moving when passion alone isn't enough. The importance of resilience, especially for high achievers who often face burnout.
fourCornerstones.love: What amplifies the other cornerstones - grounding them in meaning and connection. Love isn't just a feeling - it's a choice and action.

tenHPillars.name: Holistic
tenHPillars.description: Viewing life as an integrated whole where work, personal matters, and health align harmoniously

tenHPillars.name: Happiness
tenHPillars.description: Prioritizing genuine joy as a central daily element

tenHPillars.name: Helpfulness
tenHPillars.description: Supporting others across teams, families, and communities

tenHPillars.name: Humor
tenHPillars.description: Finding levity and not taking oneself too seriously

tenHPillars.name: Humility
tenHPillars.description: Remaining grounded and open to continuous learning

tenHPillars.name: Honesty
tenHPillars.description: Being truthful with yourself and others through authentic engagement

tenHPillars.name: Health
tenHPillars.description: Caring for physical, mental, and emotional well-being

tenHPillars.name: Holiness
tenHPillars.description: Connecting with purpose and meaning beyond oneself

transformationStory.originMoment: At 17, a math teacher told him 'You'll never amount to anything' in the middle of class. He believed him and dropped out six weeks later to join the Navy.
turningPoints: 2007: Prophetess Juanita's revelation: 'When are you gonna realize you're the blessing?'
2012: First HubSpot INBOUND conference - 'The humanity-focused message spoke to my soul and my purpose'
First keynote: Marcus Sheridan's advice on vulnerability at Cheesecake Factory dinner
transformationStory.redemptionNarrative: He's no longer angry about what happened; he's grateful. He wouldn't take the lost years back if offered. If he saw that math teacher today, he would thank him. That teacher 'tossed fuel on the fire that created the man - and the empowering educator - I am today.'
transformationStory.keyRealization: Until you embrace being vulnerable, you're going to miss out on the magic in life.

familyAndFaith.familyRole: Dedicated father and husband who prioritizes family. His business is built around the 'FEAM' concept - a blend of 'family' and 'team' where his wife and children work collaboratively.
familyAndFaith.faithBackground: Man of faith who sees purpose beyond himself. Background as youth pastor and youth leader at local church in Ohio. Faith influenced his human-centered approach to business and education.
familyAndFaith.churchOrigins: Creative agency journey started at church where he fell in love with his creative side through building projection systems for songs/sermon notes and the church website.

credentials.yearsExperience: 25+ years of sales and marketing experience
